About

Hello, Tech-World

I'm Solomon Zelenko and programming is my craft.

My tools of choice are: problem solving, patience, and teamwork.

While studying neuroscience, I supported my education by teaching young children applied math, coding, and creative problem solving. Openworld Learning was an after-school program that brought those skills to disadvantaged children in the Denver Area.

As my students matured and overcame challenges, I was inspired. From 2015 to 2018, I discovered that I enjoyed programming - whether the code ran or humbled me. So I took a chance on myself and revised my career path.

By the start of 2020, this decision culminated in 2 years of self, group, and mentored study; 3 portfolio projects; and a new perspective. Bottom line, I write clean code, have the mindset to identify and solve problems, and enjoy the challenges.

When it's time to take a break, you can find me practicing voiceover acting, staying healthy, and appreciating the details.
